title: Multiplying the Numerator and Denominator
text: We can multiply the numerator and denominators to get $$\frac{\left(x^2-4x\right) \left(x+2\right)}{x\left(x^2+5x+6\right)}$$

title: Simplifying if Necessary
text: This fraction can be simplified through factoring. $$\frac{\left(x^2-4x\right) \left(x+2\right)}{x\left(x^2+5x+6\right)}=\frac{x\left(x-4\right) \left(x+2\right)}{x\left(x+3\right) \left(x+2\right)}=\frac{x-4}{x+3}$$
